metadata.title: CVE-2018-20467 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
In coders/bmp.c in ImageMagick before 7.0.8-16, an input file can result inan infinite loop and hang, with high CPU and memory consumption. Remoteattackers could leverage this vulnerability to cause a denial of servicevia a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20467` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm8
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm8
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm8
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm8
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm8
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm8
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm8
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.13+esm8').
